Question 1: A surgeon is to perform a mastoidectomy procedure for a patient with CSOM. He uses the 
following instrument during the procedure. What is the name of the given instrument?
questions.explanation:
The above image shows Mollison’s mastoid retractor. It is used in mastoidectomy procedures to 
retract soft tissues after incision and elevation of flaps. It is self-retaining and hemostatic. Shown below is Jansen’s self-retaining mastoid retractor.

questions.question:
Question 3: A 25-year-old patient is to undergo mastoid surgery. Which of the following instruments will 
not be present in the operation theatre?
questions.explanation:
Lempert’s trocar does not exist. Option A: Lempert’s curette (scoop) is used for removal of bony septa and granulations in mastoid 
surgery. 573 
Sold by @itachibot Option B: Lempert’s endaural retractor is used for endaural approach to ear surgery. It has two 
lateral blades which retract the flaps and a third central blade with holes. The central blade 
retracts the temporalis muscle. The central blade can be fixed to the body of the retractor by its 
hole. Option C: Lempert’s endaural speculum is used to spread open the meatus when giving the local 
injection or making an endaural incision. 574 
Sold by @itachibot Lempert’s incision is used in endaural approach. It consists of two parts: Lempert I: It is a semicircular incision, made from 12 o’clock to 6 o’clock position in the posterior 
meatal wall at the bony-cartilaginous junction. Lempert II: Starts from the first incision at 12 o’clock and then passes upwards in a curvilinear 
fashion between tragus and the crus of helix. It passes through the incisura terminalis and thus 
does not cut the cartilage. Both mastoid and external canal surgery can be done.

questions.question:
Question 4: A patient is undergoing a mastoidectomy procedure. During the procedure, a surgeon uses 
the following instrument to explore the mastoid air cells. Name the given instrument 567 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The above image is a MacEwen’s curette and cell seeker. During mastoid surgeries, one end is 
used to explore the air cells and the other end is used to curette the intervening septa and 575 
Sold by @itachibot granulations. Note: MacEwan’s (suprameatal) triangle is an important landmark to locate the mastoid antrum 
in mastoid surgery. It is bounded by- • Temporal line • The posterosuperior segment of the bony external auditory canal • The line drawn as a tangent to the external canal

questions.question: Question 5: Which procedure is the following instrument not used in?
questions.explanation: The image shows Luc’s forceps. It is not used in FESS. Luc’s forceps is used in: • Caldwell- Luc operation - to remove mucosa • Submucosal resection- to remove bone or cartilage • Polypectomy- to grasp and avulse polyps • To take a biopsy from the nose or throat

questions.question: Question 6: The following instrument is:
questions.explanation:
The image is of a Ballenger swivel knife. It is used in the removal of septal cartilage in SMR 
(Submucosal resection) operation. The blade of the knife revolves automatically and changes direction when cutting the cartilage 
anteroposteriorly downwards and posteroanteriorly. Different sizes of blades are present. It can 
be used to harvest septal cartilage as a graft for reconstruction. 576 
Sold by @itachibot

Question 7: A 35-year-old man with chronic sinusitis undergoes the following procedure to relieve him of 
his symptoms. Which of the following instruments is required to carry out this procedure? 569

questions.question:
Question 8: Given below is an instrument used for irrigation. In which of the following procedures will it 
not be used?
questions.explanation:
The instrument is Rose’s sinus douching cannula. It is used in irrigation of the maxillary sinus, 
which should already have a nasoantral window due to intranasal antrostomy or Caldwell Luc 
operation. The direction of the tip is indicated by the hook outside. Note: Trephination (also known as trepanning or burr holing) is a surgical intervention where a hole is 
drilled, incised or scraped into the skull using simple surgical tools. Trephination of frontal sinus 
is done for acute frontal sinusitis if there is persistence or exacerbation of pain or pyrexia in spite 
of medical treatment for 48 h or if the lid swelling is increasing and threatening orbital cellulitis.

questions.question:
Question 9: A 20-year-old woman has complaints of reduced hearing on her right side. You perform a 
diagnostic test using the following instrument. What is the name of this instrument?
questions.explanation:
The image is of a Digital audiometer. An audiometer is an electronic device that produces pure tones, which can be increased or 
decreased in 5 dB steps. The amount of intensity that has to be raised above the normal level is a 
measure of the degree of hearing loss at that frequency. This is charted in the form of a graph 577 
Sold by @itachibot called an audiogram. The difference in the thresholds of air and bone conduction (A–B gap) is a measure of the degree 
of conductive deafness. Uses: • To measure the threshold of hearing of air and bone conduction • Helps to predict speech reception threshold • To diagnose the type of hearing loss and measure the degree • For the prescription of hearing aids • Helps to find the degree of handicap for medicolegal purposes • A record can be kept for future reference.

questions.question:
Question 10: An objective diagnostic test is performed on a patient who complains of loss of hearing on his 
right side. The following instrument is used to perform this test. What is this instrument 
known as? 571 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The image is of a tympanometer. It is used in evaluating the status of the middle ear. It is based on a simple principle that when a sound strikes the tympanic membrane, some of the 
sound energy is absorbed while the rest is reflected. A stiffer tympanic membrane would reflect 
more sound energy than a compliant one. By charting the compliance of the tympano-ossicular system against various pressure changes, 
different types of graphs called tympanograms are as follows: 578 
Sold by @itachibot
